# The `HashBuilder` Class Template Reference

<DoxygenPage pluginConfig={pluginConfig}>

Interface to help hash various types through a hasher type. <a href="#details">More...</a>

## Declaration

<CodeBlock>template &lt;typename HasherT, llvm::endianness Endianness&gt;
class llvm::HashBuilder&lt;HasherT, Endianness&gt;</CodeBlock>

## Description {#details}

Interface to help hash various types through a hasher type.

Via provided specializations of <code>add</code>, <code>addRange</code>, and <code>addRangeElements</code> functions, various types (e.g. <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a></code>, <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a></code>, etc.) can be hashed without requiring any knowledge of hashed types from the hasher type.

The only method expected from the templated hasher type <code>HasherT</code> is:
<ul>
<li>void <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hashbuilderbase/#ae3ff56a4d35e4dd4630e8abdb80d1bb9">update(ArrayRef&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; Data)</a></li>
</ul>


Additionally, the following methods will be forwarded to the hasher type:
<ul>
<li>decltype(std::declval&lt;HasherT &amp;&gt;().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hashbuilderbase/#a6e5cbc4cd359a97743ffbfa4abc13d73">final()</a>) <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hashbuilderbase/#a6e5cbc4cd359a97743ffbfa4abc13d73">final()</a></li>
<li>decltype(std::declval&lt;HasherT &amp;&gt;().<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hashbuilderbase/#aad2f567a2782a06b3116aed7e92047fd">result()</a>) <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hashbuilderbase/#aad2f567a2782a06b3116aed7e92047fd">result()</a></li>
</ul>


From a user point of view, the interface provides the following:
<ul>
<li><code>template&lt;typename T&gt; add(const T &amp;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/value">Value</a>)</code> The <code>add</code> function implements hashing of various types.</li>
<li><code>template &lt;typename ItT&gt; void addRange(ItT First, ItT Last)</code> The <code>addRange</code> function is designed to aid hashing a range of values. It explicitly adds the size of the range in the hash.</li>
<li><code>template &lt;typename ItT&gt; void addRangeElements(ItT First, ItT Last)</code> The <code>addRangeElements</code> function is also designed to aid hashing a range of values. In contrast to <code>addRange</code>, it <b>ignores</b> the size of the range, behaving as if elements were added one at a time with <code>add</code>.</li>
</ul>


User-defined <code>struct</code> types can participate in this interface by providing an <code>addHash</code> templated function. See the associated template specialization for details.

This interface does not impose requirements on the hasher <code>update(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt; Data)</code> method. We want to avoid collisions for variable-size types; for example for 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">builder.add(&#123;1&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">builder.add(&#123;2, 3&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
 and 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">builder.add(&#123;1, 2&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">builder.add(&#123;3&#125;);</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
 . Thus, specializations of <code>add</code> and <code>addHash</code> for variable-size types must not assume that the hasher type considers the size as part of the hash; they must explicitly add the size to the hash. See for example specializations for <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a></code> and <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/stringref">StringRef</a></code>.

Additionally, since types are eventually forwarded to the hasher&#39;s <code>void update(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/arrayref">ArrayRef</a>&lt;uint8&#95;t&gt;)</code> method, endianness plays a role in the hash computation (for example when computing <code>add((int)123)</code>). Specifiying a non-<code>native</code> <code>Endianness</code> template parameter allows to compute stable hash across platforms with different endianness.

Definition at line 139 of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/hashbuilder-h">HashBuilder.h</a>.

### add() {#a10e1cde5bdf37faed1fafd171aa33619}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename T&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>std::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt; is&#95;detected&lt; HasAddHashT, T &gt;::value &amp;&amp;!hashbuilder&#95;detail::IsHashableData&lt; T &gt;::value, HashBuilder &amp; &gt; llvm::HashBuilder&lt; HasherT, Endianness &gt;::add (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> T &amp; Value)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
Implement hashing for user-defined <code>struct</code>s.

<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/any">Any</a> user-define <code>struct</code> can participate in hashing via <code><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/hashbuilder">HashBuilder</a></code> by providing a <code>addHash</code> templated function.


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasherT, llvm::endianness Endianness&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> addHash(<a href="#a3790ea10d4f6d2364d6b1fb2bddfbf4e">HashBuilder&lt;HasherT, Endianness&gt;</a> &amp;HBuilder,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">             </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> UserDefinedStruct &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>);</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


For example: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">SimpleStruct &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">char</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> c;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> i;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasherT, llvm::endianness Endianness&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> addHash(<a href="#a3790ea10d4f6d2364d6b1fb2bddfbf4e">HashBuilder&lt;HasherT, Endianness&gt;</a> &amp;HBuilder,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">             </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> SimpleStruct &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  HBuilder.add(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>.c);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  HBuilder.add(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a066e2a31a13d6520e52ae1944f194662">Value</a>.i);</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">&#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


To avoid endianness issues, specializations of <code>addHash</code> should generally rely on exising <code>add</code>, <code>addRange</code>, and <code>addRangeElements</code> functions. If directly using <code>update</code>, an implementation must correctly handle endianness.


<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">&#95;&#95;attribute&#95;&#95; ((packed)) StructWithFastHash &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>


To avoid collisions, specialization of <code>addHash</code> for variable-size types must take the size into account.

For example: 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="keyword">struct </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">CustomContainer &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">private</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">int</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/logicalview/#a8d87e69e124542d3338b631934cdbea9aaa56a2e65d8106aef3c61e4f6bf94fdb">Elements</a>&#91;100&#93;;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">public</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">:</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  CustomContainer(</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>) : <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>(<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">for</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (</Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">size&#95;t</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> = 0; <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a> != <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/analysis/inlineorder-cpp/#a7ee6f0cb51c3b9056199e9a0001fe8c3a6f6cb72d544962fa333e2e34ce64f719">Size</a>; ++<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/logicalview/#a8d87e69e124542d3338b631934cdbea9aaa56a2e65d8106aef3c61e4f6bf94fdb">Elements</a>&#91;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>&#93; = <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/support/md5-cpp/#ac0eafdc9ee161b71e7af98af736952fd">I</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">template</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> &lt;</Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">typename</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> HasherT, llvm::endianness Endianness&gt;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">friend</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">void</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> addHash(HashBuilder&lt;HasherT, Endianness&gt; &amp;HBuilder,</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">                      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">const</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> CustomContainer &amp;Value) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (Endianness == <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ae1e26e57357947b25e392fd18ab000dba8e5f3adee38c8fccc13c1f3be0143796">llvm::endianness::native</a>) &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      HBuilder.update(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab9c6b351507d3c0730f4290919d43a12">ArrayRef</a>(</Highlight></CodeLine>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// &#96;addRange&#96; will take care of encoding the size.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal">      HBuilder.addRange(&amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/targetstackid/#a71392100eb15ba746b1f898986f5d8a5">Value</a>.Elements&#91;0&#93;, &amp;<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/targetstackid/#a71392100eb15ba746b1f898986f5d8a5">Value</a>.Elements&#91;0&#93; +</Highlight></CodeLine>

### add() {#a3a94d5635dcb6728b77fc7ae9157abb4}

<MemberDefinition
  template={<>template &lt;typename... Ts&gt;</>}
  prototype={<>std::enable&#95;if&#95;t&lt;(sizeof...(Ts) &gt; 1), HashBuilder &amp; &gt; llvm::HashBuilder&lt; HasherT, Endianness &gt;::add (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> Ts &amp;... Args)</>}
  labels = {["inline"]}>
A convenenience variadic helper.

It simply iterates over its arguments, in order. 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a91945efc8e44a3f170402a1b1a2316fe">add</a>(Arg1, Arg2);</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>
 is equivalent to 
<ProgramListing>

<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a91945efc8e44a3f170402a1b1a2316fe">add</a>(Arg1)</Highlight></CodeLine>
<CodeLine><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="#a91945efc8e44a3f170402a1b1a2316fe">add</a>(Arg2)</Highlight></CodeLine>

</ProgramListing>

Definition at line <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/hashbuilder-h/#l00323">323</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/hashbuilder-h">HashBuilder.h</a>.
</MemberDefinition>
